page.title: 05Mixed Farming - Farlesthorpe
page.content: The farmer lives and works on Glede Farm Farlesthorpe which belongs to the Church Commissioners of the Church of England. His land covers 42 acres,43 including the house,yard and a small wood. Some livestock is kept (beef,pigs and some poultry).Poultry is kept mainly for egg laying but some is used for food at Christmas and Easter.Crops grown are wheat(20 acres),barley(10 acres) and potatoes(13 acres). The land is good quality. The farmer employs contractors to spread manure from the beasts and uses artificial fertilisers. Farm machinery is owned by the farmer apart from combine harvesters which are hired. The only employees are seasonal workers.
